channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Assume Russia ends up controlling all of Ukraine. Then what? It seems the next confrontation will be in Estonia, Lithuania and Latvia, also former USSR republics, and unlike Ukraine, they are part of NATO.
I make great salads. One of my secrets is to add some of this stuff, chopped in big pieces to every salad. https://t.co/cNaiVvwDPD
I'm looking forward to a NYC art museum that has a room where you can smoke weed.
Today's song: Back in the USSR. https://t.co/r89q7oRTs3
Will the press let Trump brand social media lies as 'TRUTH'? https://t.co/U1uBNeYrhA
@mooreds it's accessible for me.

1/3 If Twitter Articles is what it appears to be, Twitter is about to become a much more important part of the open web, assuming it's all accessible through the API in both directions (apps can post articles, as well as read them) and if it supports linking. It's very late, but
2/3 better late than never, and in the future it'll mean that blogging tools such as the one I offer in Drummer, will be able to peer with Twitter without hacks. Yes, we'll probably have to give up some features, and if the API isn't there then that would kind of render the whole
3/3 thing null and void, but all we've been asking for from Twitter et al is there in the screen shot. And if they need RSS support I'll be ready to provide it.

I think I'm going to wait and see what Twitter Articles are like before offering a service to create RSS feeds from tweet streams. I have the code working, but deploying and supporting it is a whole other story. I don't want to get in their way. Let's see what the have.
In 2016 I wrote a piece that explained in a simple list what bloggers needed from Twitter and Facebook.
It looks like, from the screen shot that was posted yesterday, that it's all there in Twitter Articles. It just has to be in the API.
https://t.co/hH8Kha4Qd9
With Nord Stream 2 shut down, didn't we just give Putin a strong financial incentive to take Ukraine? That's how the other pipeline gets to Europe.
@daverpvb How is that irony?
How much curling can you watch? https://t.co/Jwx9D8ketQ
Mike Bloomberg warns Democrats of midterm "wipeout." https://t.co/KUzLgTbxxi
Book Hotels with EV Charging Stations Worldwide. https://t.co/2KIiiAXdOr+–+English&fbclid=IwAR0ZRH3iqL75Il_pdfCXc5N8lPUUwcXl0IOLfWNBjK2E-JlKZ7KPU_HMkug
Whether or not we believe in Biden is hardly the question. The question is what kind of hell waits for us after the November election? https://t.co/K9k5hnsZUn
Germany takes steps to halt Nord Stream 2. https://t.co/yUe10jtClo
Putin’s absurd, angry spectacle will be a turning point in his long reign. https://t.co/C16FCI5eoh

Welcome to the day of twos.
More twos than a body can use.
If two is your number today is your day.
One is the loneliest number but two is for both of you.
What Putin Really Wants in Ukraine. https://t.co/RuwD7L1p3S
Why Ukraine gave up nuclear weapons and what that means in a Russian invasion. https://t.co/eYN3nZyff4
Inside a former S.F. church, a battle for the future of knowledge. https://t.co/KWmlIYuDg8

NATO member countries: Albania Belgium Bulgaria Canada Croatia Czech Republic Denmark Estonia France Germany Greece Hungary Iceland Italy...
Latvia Lithuania Luxembourg Montenegro Netherlands North Macedonia Norway Poland Portugal Romania Slovakia Slovenia Spain Turkey United Kingdom United States
Note the former parts of the USSR in NATO:
1. Estonia
2. Latvia
3. Lithuania

If anyone knows about the Twitter articles editor, please get in touch via DM. Willing to sign NDA. Big questions. 1. Available through the API for reading, publishing? 2. Character limit on articles? 3. RSS feed for articles? https://t.co/EmHZachCBI
@cbasturea thanks -- this is very important and good news.
